title: Introduction to Data Analytics
description: Start your journey into data analytics with essential concepts and practical techniques
content: Data Analytics is the process of examining data sets to draw conclusions about the information they contain. This field has become essential in today's data-driven world, where organizations rely on insights to make informed decisions. Key areas include descriptive analytics (what happened), diagnostic analytics (why it happened), predictive analytics (what will happen), and prescriptive analytics (what should we do). Essential tools include Excel for basic analysis, SQL for database queries, Python and R for statistical computing, and visualization tools like Tableau and Power BI. The analytics process involves data collection, cleaning, exploration, analysis, and interpretation. Understanding data types, statistical measures, and visualization techniques forms the foundation for effective data analysis.

title: Advanced Python for Data Science

description: Test your knowledge of data analytics concepts, tools, and methodologies

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of exploratory data analysis (EDA)?
options: To create final visualizations for presentations
To understand data patterns and identify anomalies

questions.question: Which Python library is most commonly used for data manipulation?
Which visualization is best for showing correlation between two variables?
What is the difference between supervised and unsupervised learning?
options: Supervised uses labeled data, unsupervised doesn't
Supervised uses more data than unsupervised

title: Machine Learning Fundamentals
description: Comprehensive introduction to machine learning concepts and practical applications
content: Machine Learning (ML) is a branch of artificial intelligence that focuses on building systems that can learn from data and make predictions or decisions without being explicitly programmed for every scenario. There are three main types of ML: supervised learning (using labeled data), unsupervised learning (finding patterns in unlabeled data), and reinforcement learning (learning through interaction and feedback). Common supervised learning tasks include classification (predicting categories) and regression (predicting continuous values). Popular algorithms include linear regression, decision trees, random forests, and neural networks. The ML workflow involves data preprocessing, feature selection, model training, evaluation using metrics like accuracy and precision, and deployment. Understanding concepts like overfitting, cross-validation, and bias-variance tradeoff is crucial for building effective ML models.

description: Build interactive dashboards and business reports using Tableau's powerful visualization tools

description: Comprehensive assessment of statistical concepts, hypothesis testing, and data interpretation

questions.question: What is the purpose of a p-value in hypothesis testing?
Which measure of central tendency is most affected by outliers?
What does a correlation coefficient of -0.85 indicate?
In A/B testing, what is a Type I error?
options: Failing to detect a real effect
Detecting an effect that doesn't exist

title: Advanced SQL and Database Analytics
description: Master complex SQL queries, window functions, and database optimization techniques
content: Advanced SQL encompasses sophisticated querying techniques that go beyond basic SELECT statements. Window functions allow calculations across related rows without grouping, enabling complex analytics like running totals, moving averages, and ranking. Common table expressions (CTEs) provide readable ways to write complex queries by breaking them into manageable parts. Query optimization involves understanding execution plans, indexing strategies, and database statistics to improve performance. Advanced topics include stored procedures for encapsulating business logic, triggers for automated responses to data changes, and views for simplifying complex queries. Modern databases also support JSON operations, full-text search, and analytical functions that enable sophisticated data analysis directly within the database.

title: Cloud Computing and Big Data Fundamentals
description: Explore cloud computing platforms, big data processing, and distributed systems architecture
content: Cloud Computing has revolutionized how organizations store, process, and analyze data at scale. Major cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud provide Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), Platform as a Service (PaaS), and Software as a Service (SaaS) solutions. Big Data technologies handle the Volume, Velocity, and Variety of modern data streams. Apache Hadoop provides distributed storage and processing capabilities, while Apache Spark offers in-memory computing for faster analytics. Data lakes store raw data in its native format, while data warehouses provide structured storage for analytics. Modern architectures leverage containerization with Docker and orchestration with Kubernetes for scalable deployments. Understanding concepts like horizontal scaling, load balancing, fault tolerance, and eventual consistency is crucial for building robust cloud-native applications.
